Summary: The economic fallout from coronavirus restrictions helped cut investment in shipbuilding to its lowest level in 11 years in the first quarter, with work at Asian shipyards nearly halted and owners holding back on orders as global demand for goods nosedived.

Title: Shell Delays $1 Billion North Sea Development
Summary: Royal Dutch Shell has postponed its Jackdaw natural-gas field development in the North Sea, as energy companies slash spending in response to plummeting prices.

Title: Coronavirus Contract Disputes Start Hitting the Courts
Summary: Companies are suspending or terminating business agreements by relying on a common but rarely invoked escape hatch in many commercial contracts.

Title: Fall of Natural Gas Prices Speeds Energy Shift in East Asia
Summary: When natural gas became as cheap as coal in the U.S., it spawned an energy transformation that drove many companies out of business while generating opportunities for others. East Asia’s biggest economies are now going through the same upheaval.
